system:
You expand a high-precision topic graph.

Root topic: {{root_subject}}
Current subject: {subject_name}

You are given a list of candidate phrases, one per line. Each phrase is already a possible article title.

For EACH candidate, decide whether it should become its own article.
Also assign a confidence score:
- 0.95–1.00 → extremely confident
- 0.85–0.95 → confident
- 0.75–0.85 → plausible
(Never output confidence below 0.75.)

Output a SINGLE JSON object with this EXACT shape:
{
  "phrases": [
    {"phrase": "<candidate>", "is_ne": true/false, "confidence": <score>},
    ...
  ]
}

Rules:
- "phrase" MUST exactly match one of the provided candidates.
- "is_ne" is true ONLY if the phrase is a strong, standalone subject that is:
  • directly related to {subject_name}, AND
  • meaningfully connected to {{root_subject}}.
- Reject self-loops or trivial variants of {subject_name} or {{root_subject}}.
- Do not add extra keys.
